column1: over the wicket, full outside, some swing back in and left alone
played into the off side
full, wide outside off, through to the keeper
nearly dragged on! This comes back from outside off, on a good length, takes a think inside edge between his legs as he defends
beaten! Well bowled, Khawaja walking across the crease and down the pitch, he drags the length back and nibbles past the edge
cleaned him up! That's the perfect finish to an excellent over. A full length, coming back in at the left hander, he goes for a drive and it's through him. Feet stuck in the crease
full outside off, some shape away, left alone
flicks a straighter delivery into midwicket to get off the mark
good length, angled across outside off, left alone
touch fuller, outside off, Marsh lets it go through and ends up looking at the keeper
a shorter delivery, just down the leg side, lets it go through and that's called wide...pretty tough call really
back on a good length at off stump, defended to backward point
that's a very good shot, wasn't a bad ball, leaning back at a reasonably full delivery outside off and drives it square through good
an appeal for lbw that but that pitch well outside leg
good delivery, full at the stumps, Finch comes forward and plays to mid-off
starts outside leg on a good length, clipped off the pads through square leg
better line, more on middle and leg, defended back down the pitch...can get even a touch more across Finch than that
back of a length, outside off, driving off the back foot and it skews from a thickish edge to third man
nearly drags trying to leave! Full outside off, Marsh made a late decision to pull out of the shot and the ball shoots off the inside edge past the stumps
full and straight, straightens on Marsh, pushed to mid-on
short of a length at off stump, on the back foot and defended to cover
fuller, outside off, nice line and left alone
another inside edge past the stumps! Full outside off, swings back, Marsh goes for a booming drive and the ball scoots past leg stump
a short ball outside off, Marsh goes after it and gets more top edge than middle towards third man
back of a length, angled into the pads, into the leg side
lovely shot, leans into a half volley and places it perfectly through the covers
pulls the length back, angled in at off stump, defended to the covers
back of a length outside off, 140kph, left alone
outside off, back of a length, defended to point with an open face
well bowled, fuller at off stump, defended back towards the bowler
a full one outside off, left alone
over the wicket, good length at off stump, angled down to third man
short of a length outside off, some swing away, left alone...carries low to Rizwan
touch fuller, outside off, leaves this one safely
big inside edge to square leg! Junaid strikes in his first over. Back of a length, shapes in at Marsh who plays forward, takes a thick edge into the pad loops to Shan Masood just in front of square
comes round the wicket to Handscomb, off the mark nicely as he stands tall and punches off the back foot through the overs
back over the wicket, good length outside off, he goes to play it square but is a little cramped for room and gets a bottom edge
just back of a length, on leg stump, played into midwicket
fuller, at the stumps, good delivery which is defended to mid-off
full at middle, Finch shuffles across the crease and defends
good length at off stump, onto the front foot and defends to cover
touch shorter and on the pads, flicked into midwicket
on the pads, flicked into midwicket but can't beat the field and that's a maiden
over the wicket, back of a length at off stump, defended to cover
134kph, back of a length and straight, defended to the bowler
fuller, 136kph, at the stumps, played to the covers
a shorter delivery, shuffles across the crease and flicks into square leg
comes round the wicket and is met with a drive on the up, through the covers, but it's hauled in
back over the wicket (not sure why he's been going round), full at the stumps, defended
full, angled into the pads, clipped nicely through square leg. Excellent timing
and now he goes straight down the ground! Shot of the day so far, leans into a full delivery and drives it straight of mid-on
pulls the length back, tucked into midwicket
139kph, too much width outside off, short as well, square driven through point. Pressure on Hasnain
drags this one and it's four boundaries in the over, tough education for the youngster, as Handscomb swivels on a pull backward of square
full at the stumps, clipped to mid-on
plays across the line of a back-of-a-length delivery, takes the pad but pitched well outside leg and was very high
that's a lovely piece of timing, gets inside the line of a short-of-a-length delivery and flicks it beautifully through square leg
pushes the line outside off, back of a length, defended
short of a length, whips this from around off stump into midwicket
leg side again, shorter on the pads, taken off the hip through square leg
walking right across the stumps to a very full delivery, playing off the back foot and clips it through the leg side. Not quite out of the coaching manual
very full, tapped to mid-on
shorter delivery, this straightens on Finch and squares him up as he aims to the leg side
good length at off stump, pushed to the covers, a touch of uncertainty in the run but all is fine
full at leg stump, flicked into midwicket
full at off stump, comes forward and drives to cover
full at middle, defended to the on side
stays leg side of a good length delivery, angles down to third man
short of a length at off stump, worked to mid-on
touch fuller, 137kph, at off stump, played with a straight bat to midwicket
on off stump, 135kph, back of a length, defended to point
an appeal for lbw as Finch plays across the line, but it's very high and probably pitched outside leg. Not much going for that
fuller, whipping across his front pad from deep in the crease, gets it into square leg
full at the stumps, driven firmly wide of cover and long-off can't prevent the second
thumped straight down the ground, a powerful strike from Finch, a touch more air perhaps, he stayed in his crease and just swung through it
shorter, flatter, punched off the back foot wide of deep cover
worked off the pads into midwicket
full, driven back at the bowler
goes back to quite a full delivery outside off, plays square to point
full outside off, 136kph, driven to mid-off
short of a length on the pads, rebounds to the on side and Junaid is quickly onto it to prevent the run
good length outside off, he walks across the crease and plays towards point
angled away from off stump into the gap at cover
top shot! He's looking very good today, this is full at off stump, takes a stride forward and places it wide of mid-off
back of a length at leg stump, defended to the on side
short of a length, driven off the back foot to deep cover
full, driven to the bowler
nearly gets through as Handscomb plays back to a full delivery that skids on, takes an inside edge to the leg side
uses his feet, doesn't quite to the pitch but adjusts nicely to drive down to long-off...brings up the fifty stand
drives a full delivery down to long-off
short outside off, he rocks back and drives to deep cover
round the wicket, full at leg stump, pushed back down the pitch
short of a length, driven wide of short cover
full outside off, driven to the cover sweeper
plays back and bunts this down the ground to long-on
dabbed square into the off side
that's a wonderful shot, although won't quite reach the boundary, as he skips down the pitch and drives inside out along the ground through cover
Finch is forward, and threads a full ball through cover, returning for a second
some drift takes this one closer to Finch's legs, and he pushes through mid on to turn the strike over
a neat little shimmy gets him to the pitch, but Shan dives at extra cover to stop the drive
eased down to long on for one
just a little short outside off, and he's tapped through cover
Handscomb steps out, and he's not to the pitch but slices a cut out to the sweeper to keep the strike
Handscomb jumps out confidently again, but his drive pings cover
full outside off, and this one is pushed straighter and down to long off
nicely bowled, not full enough to drive and drifting in towards middle and leg. Finch comes forward with bat and pad together
pressed to cover
nicely placed into a gap straight of midwicket, and they're back for a second
Finch stays in his crease at pushes back to the bowler
he's down the track again, driving hard back to the bowler
Handscomb drives to long off for one
fuller this time, and he drives through cover
Yasir spots Handscomb coming down and pulls his length back, but Handscomb gets his hands out to slice a drive through cover
thumped firmly, but straight to long off
lobbed up fairly high, and Handscomb turns the strike over
full, on off stump, and the drive goes to cover
Finch drives, and again hits cover
Haris is flighting them much more than Imad would have, slowing it up, and Finch keeps hitting the field
this time he drives straighter, to long off

nicely played by Handscomb, who once again uses his feet well to get to the pitch of a flighted delivery, and then lets his bottom hand do the work to whip the pull firmly in the air and right in the gap wide of long on
punched firmly, straight to cover
this time Finch waits on a cut, but a diving stop at point keeps him at home
a touch of frustration possibly creeping in as Finch finds no width to work with and nudges defensively to leg
straight again, and it's tucked into the leg side field
midwicket has more work to do as Finch works a full one straight to him
slightly wide of off, and a back foot punch finds the cover sweeper in the deep

sharp work from Rizwan! Finch dead-bats it really close in and wanders out looking for one, but Rizwan drops to his left and back-hands the ball back at the stumps, on the dive. Finch also dived, trying to make his ground. Had he hit, Finch would have been out
punched down the ground, in the air but past a diving Haris and down to long off
Handscomb's down the track and to the pitch, but he can't beat midwicket
straighter this time, and there's room for one
Finch gets back and across, but his punch finds the field
full, on his legs, and it's pushed back to the bowler
Handscomb jumps out to get at the ball, opening the face to slice his drive into space at cover
tapped down behind square, but at the fielder
Imad aims for middle and off, and Finch can do nothing with it
slightly quicker through the air, and straighter, but Finch's defensive jab keeps it out
pressed to cover, but again he can't beat the field

flight, drift and turn! Handscomb has used his feet so well, but he chooses to play this one from the crease, lunging forward at it even as he's done in the flight. The ball grips and turns past his outside edge, knocking back the off stump. Wonderfully bowled
Stoinis spots some width and he's off the mark with a push through cover
nicely placed by Finch, who skips out to get close to the ball and works neatly through midwicket
eased down to long off to turn the strike over
looped down nicely straight from around the stumps, Stoinis defending watchfully
this might have just held up in the slow track a little, and Stoinis pops it uppishly into the covers as he's forward to defend
there's width on offer, and a cut finds the cover sweeper
Stoinis presents the full face of the bat to drive to long off
this one is a touch slower through the air, drawing Finch forward in defence
pushed through at 92km/h outside off, and it's pushed to cover
Finch lays bat on a late cut, but finds short third man
full and straight, and Finch defends - his 46th dot ball in his innings so far. There have been 88 dots in the Australian innings
Stoinis stays deep in his crease, punching through the gap at cover
this should have been another dot, but the ball bursts through Shan's hands at extra cover, and the long barrier is slow to come down as the ball zips past him

Stoinis appears to have clipped his own ankle with the bat, and he seems to be in some pain. He skipped out to get to the pitch, but his bat came down behind the pad and jammed into his ankle as he tried to work to leg. He completes the run, but then sits down to get some attention from the physio. It doesn't look like anything too serious, he's got a smile on his face
pushed through cover, but not into the gap
straighter this time, and Finch glances across his pad to find a single to deep midwicket
nicely bowled, dipping towards middle and leg, but Stoinis is forward to defend solidly
and there's a third fifty in a row for Aaron Finch, who places this nudge well enough to get back for a second
pressed firmly back to the bowler
a late cut goes just fine enough of short third man for a single
speared in at middle and leg, and it's pushed back to him
Stoinis comes forward, and again Imad fields off his own bowling
Stoinis presses forward again, tapping softly to cover
slapped up and over cover, Haris having gifted Finch a long hop outside off. Could have hit it anywhere
a touch flatter, and straighter too. Pushed to cover
Finch puts some gusto into a drive, but picks out cover to perfection
Finch possibly just tries to hit this one a bit too hard, bottom edging a hack straight into the ground
slower through the air, and fuller. Finch defends
pushed through cover, and into the gap this time
speared in at his legs, and Finch whips across his pad to get the ball through square leg
very straight again, and it's glanced to short fine
punched to cover, on the up and at the fielder
the point fielder dives over the top of a chopped cut, but cover sweeper cleans up
drifting down towards his pads, but Finch can't put any bat on this glance
whipped firmly, but straight to midwicket
punched through cover, and out to the sweeper
nicely flighted by Haris, and Finch can only defend
tossed up slightly wider of off, Finch driving straight to cover in the ring
too straight, and Finch works it off his legs for one
every so often, Haris offers up a hit-me ball, and this one sits up outside off as Stoinis leans back into a muscular pull out to deep midwicket
and Stoinis opts for defence to end the over
Finch heaves into the leg side, but the ball only squirts off the inside half of the shot so it's only one
punched down to long off for a single
mowed over midwicket, this is what Finch was trying to do a couple of balls ago. He sets himself and fetches the ball powerfully over the leg side field, with the drift, and into the gap
over-correction, and it's called wide
Finch looks to break free over the off side, but can only slice a drive in the air, plugging in the outfield
timber! Stoinis is neither here nor there as he swings across the line at Imad, the ball drifting and dipping past his shot and into the stumps
nicely flighted from Imad, but there's not much turn and Maxwell is forward to defend

swept fine! Finch is going to keep playing his shots, and the sweep could be a good option. Haris helps him by sending the ball down towards leg, but the shot is a good one, along the ground and very fine
good follow-up, easing down the ground to turn the strike back over
Maxwell comes forward to place a watchful drive to cover
a touch too short, and he stays on the back foot to punch through cover
tucked off the pads and quite fine down to fine leg. Imad sets after it, and keeps them to two
Finch goes back and across, pushing to point
drifting in towards middle and leg, but it's kept out
punched down to long off for one
this one is held back a touch, and the drive goes to cover
pushed out to the cover sweeper, off the back foot, and that's 150 up for Australia
speared down the leg side, and they find a run off the pad
chipped uppishly, but the ball drops well in front of long off and they trot through for one
pushed through quite flat on a leg stump line, and he's worked off the pads
pushed towards cover, and there's just enough room for a quick single
solid defence from Finch
he sets himself to whip this into the leg side, but can't get it away
punched into the covers, off the back foot
Imad finds a little spin, but this is also a little wide of off and he's placed through cover
Finch stays deep, punching off the back foot
beaten by turn and bounce! Imad is known for his drift, but this one is held back in the air and he finds significant turn, the ball dipping and zipping past the outside edge
flicked off the pads for a single
Finch slices a drive behind point
punched down the ground for a single
flicked off the pads to short fine leg
leans back to a shorter delivery and finds point
fired in at leg stump, Finch misses and gets taken on the pad
thumped! Free his arms through this delivery, full at off stump, sent racing back over Yasir's head...a skimming drive
a shorter delivery, pulled to midwicket
can't get this one away from off stump, bobbles back to the bowler, so apart from the boundary a good over from Yasir
over the wicket, short of a length at leg stump, defended
that's well bowled, some extra bouncer, takes the splice of the bat with Maxwell whipping his bottom hand off
back of a length, straight, worked to midwicket
a bouncer, over leg stump, Maxwell ducks
appeal for lbw but that had to pitch outside leg stump, was short of a length, Maxwell aiming to flick to the leg side
back of a length, flicked off the pads to deep square. Very good comeback over
short delivery at the pads, can't flick it wide of short fine leg
cut away from outside off, point dives over it somewhat and deep cover can't stop the second
pushed off the pads to midwicket
full at middle and leg, hint of drift on that one, blocked to the bowler
plays forward and defends...the dots pile up
goes back and drives a shorter delivery to deep cover
short of a length, gets on his toes and drives to cover
an aborted appeal for lbw, a fuller delivery, Finch misses his flick but it may have taken an inside edge and was miles outside leg anyway
a shorter ball, doesn't connect cleanly as he pulls and finds midwicket
full and straight, gets in through the infield this time as he drives strongly wide of mid-off
back of a length, a front foot heave through the leg side
full at middle and off, picks out mid-off with the drive this time
full at the stumps, he opens the face and plays to cover
goes for the sweep and it balloons off the pad for Rizwan to gather
goes for the drive and it skews off a thick outside edge, short of backward point
turned off the pads in front of square
plays back to quite a full delivery, angled in at leg stump, worked to deep square
goes down early and plays a powerful sweep, that sounded sweet, but goes once bounce to deep square
short of a length, straight, a front foot pull to midwicket who parries it away
full at leg stump, spears into the pads and deflects towards fine leg
banged in short, he pulls well in front of square and excellent running makes a second
full at leg stump, Maxwell tries to give himself some room but can only drive to mid-off
a short delivery on leg stump, he helps it down to fine leg as he squats on a hook
back of a length on the pads, just a single out to deep midwicket

given caught behind but Maxwell reviews straightaway! He was looking to dab this away from outside off, just short of a length, played the ball late. There's a flat line on Ultra Edge. This will be overturned
and now he brings out the reverse sweep! Maybe that will get Maxwell going. Switches around in his stance and swings this over short third man
tried the scoop this time! Got into a tangle as Yasir dragged the length back, almost played it into himself
still no Australian as three centuries in a row! Finch looking to cut loose as well, aiming over long-on, but doesn't get the distance and it's a simple catch near the rope
tries a sweep first ball, was outside off stump, doesn't make contact
makes good connection this time, sweeps a full delivery from outside off to deep square
back of a length at off stump, played to the off side and Junaid follows through quickly
shorter delivery, shapes in, tucked to the leg side
works a short-of-a-length delivery off the pads to fine leg
well bowled, move movement back into the left hander, in the air and off the seam, takes an inside edge into the pads
full at off stump, drives but can't beat mid-off
a short ball is muscled through midwicket, he put everything into that, placed it well
over the wicket, good length at off stump, opens the face and finds backward point
fuller, at off stump, 144kph, squirts off an inside edge and bobbles past the stumps. Able to steal the single
gives himself room to the leg side and drills a length delivery to deep cover
full at off stump, a nice-looking drive through the covers
length delivery, straight, worked to the leg side
dropped at point as Maxwell crunches this square of the wicket, again giving himself room, it went quickly but should have been held by Imam
gets underneath a short ball and shovels it backward of square, plenty of elevation on this and it was just a fraction short of six
driven square to deep point
another scoop/flick/pull over short fine leg, that's a superb shot, he's starting to find his range
full at off stump, driven firmly and Masood can't stop it cleanly at cover
goes for the yorker, swings in at middle and leg, takes the pad to midwicket
good yorker, dug out through midwicket and they scamper a brace which doesn't please Junaid
a short ball, pulled to wide mid-on
that's a magnificent shot, it's a low full toss outside off, he plays a slicing drive through point as he stays leg side to give himself room
all the way! Maxwell moves to fifty off 42 balls as he pulls this over backward square, was moving around his crease then swatted away the short delivery
loses his shape as he swings to leg against a length delivery, skews off the bottom edge to long leg but he's able to come back for another two
very full outside off, steered towards deep cover and he's toying with the fielders now
gives himself room and angles down to third man
short of a length, pulled through mid-on
moves outside leg then drives a full delivery straight down the ground
pushed across full and wide outside off, Maxwell misses out as he gave himself a touch too much room
swings across the line of a length delivery and picks out midwicket
big full toss on the pads, flicked high in the air, deep square can't quite get there, dives for the catch and in the process can't stop the boundary
full outside off, driven to deep cover
full at leg stump, flicked off the boot to deep square leg
well bowled, a slower short ball, deceives Maxwell who sways out of the line at the last moment
wide full toss outside off and he slices it through backward point, that raced off the bat...this is becoming some innings
good yorker, straight, clipped to midwicket
full toss at leg stump, clipped firmly but straight to midwicket on the edge of the circle

run out by the keeper! Sharp work from Rizwan. It was a short ball, Maxwell was through his shot, didn't carry on the full to Rizwan who was then alert to whip off his glove and complete the direct hit
short of a length, clubbed in the air towards long-on but doesn't carry all the way
fuller, at the stumps, angled down to third man
scooped in the air into midwicket and in lands in the middle of two fielders
carved high into the off side this time, lobs short of deep cover
back of a length at off stump, heaved down the ground to long-on...not quite finding the middle
a slower short ball, Cummins is beaten as he tries to angle it away
short outside off, a slower one into the surface, Carey gives himself room and gets a toe end to the off side
an off-stump yorker, excellent bowling, Cummins can't get it away
full and straight, heaved to deep midwicket
short outside off, another slower ball, swung through midwicket off the bottom of the bat
beaten by a slower short ball outside off, wants the wide call but it's within limits
big finish from Carey! Short outside off, he fetches it from outside off and pulls it over deep midwicket
pace and carry through to the keeper with the hard new ball. It bursts off a length outside off, Imam whipping his bat inside the line as it passed him
just short of a good length, and Imam is up on his tip toes to defend to gully
Cummins hits the splice off a length, Imam right behind it to defend
Imam's off the mark with a flick off his pads. He might have chanced a second, but he slipped slightly while turning at the non-striker's end. It's greasy out there
bursting across Shan at 142km/h, the left hander raising his hands to leave. Good pace, and an upright seam
Cummins keeps it in the channel, and Shan's happy to let this one go too
Behrendorff shares the early duties, but his first ball is sprayed down the leg side
this one pitches closer to a middle stump line, and it's defended back down the track
he's starting to find his radar now, and just a hint of shape away from the bat outside off. But Imam defends solidly from the crease
Behrendorff floats this one up outside off, Imam shouldering arms
Imam uses the width and the pace to collect a single down to third man
Shan comes half forward, defending a fuller one slightly away from his body
shaping down the leg side, and they find a single off the pad
laced through cover point! Neat work from Imam, who spotted one in the slot and stepped into a crunchy square drive
Cummins immediately pulls his length back again, and this one's left alone
slightly too straight, and he's worked off the hip down to fine leg
on a length, in the channel, and Shan chops to cover
squirting off the inside edge as Shan fends awkwardly from the crease, the ball bouncing between his legs but away from the stumps into the leg side. It definitely skidded on
short and rising outside off, Imam opting out of a pull shot at the last moment
neatly worked off the pads by Shan, but there's protection in the deep
Imam lets a full, wide one go outside off
Behrendorff aims for the channel, Imam stepping into a watchful forward defensive
hopping defence sends the ball trickling into the leg side
slashed through cover point! This boundary will help to get them ticking
punched defensively to cover
angling in from outside off, Shan defending to point

snaffled by a diving Handscomb at slip! Cummins gets the ball to straighten on Shan from around the stumps. The line makes him play, the movement finds the edge, and Handscomb at the solitary slip dives to his left to get a hand under the ball inches from the turf. It's an excellent, sharp slip catch, and Australia have drawn blood
pushed through outside off, but too wide to force him to play
this one angles in from outside off and it's slightly closer to the stumps, but Haris is in no danger as he hops into a leave
another leave from Haris, whose judgment outside off holds firm
past the inside edge! The ball was full and angled into him, Haris wafting at it with a flat-footed drive. The angle takes it through the gate, and Cummins completes a wicket maiden
on a length, and tight on off stump. Imam defends
that's a corker! Behrendorff stands the seam up and gets it to nip away and past the edge of Imam's poke
and again! Imam steps into a tentative push but the left-armer hits the seam and beats the edge. There's no bat on it, but it doesn't carry to the keeper
this one goes the other way off the seam, jagging in to him to take the inside edge onto the pad and raise some excitement behind the bat
in the channel, and Imam's nuggety defence keeps it out
tapped defensively to gully, and it's another maiden
tucked into space on the leg side
Imam hops over one that seams in to him, collecting a single through square leg

another edge! The plan is the same, and Cummins executes it to perfection to get another one. He angles it in, seams it away, and Haris goes fishing outside off to send a regulation edge through to Marsh at first slip. A regulation chance, chest high
some seam movement straight away, nipping in to hit Rizwan on the thigh
wider of off, and it's left alone

past the edge! Or has he got him? Australia appeal, Cummins is convinced, and likewise convinces Finch to take a review when the umpire says no. Kumar Dharmasena is the third umpire, and he notes a sound as ball passes bat. And ultra edge shows a spike! The decision is over-turned, and Pakistan are three down. A century for Rizwan last time, and a duck tonight
seaming in off a length, and Imam defends
Behrendorff hits the seam, the ball moving away from the left hander off the track. But it's easily left alone
Imam walks into a firm drive, but finds mid off

appeal for lbw! This one snaked in to him off the track to hit him on the pad. The umpire says no, and there's a bit of discussion ... but they decide against a review. It did look high, hitting him above the roll
too straight, and he's milked in front of square on the leg side for a brace
full and seaming away outside off. Imam steps into a watchful leave
full and angling in to him from outside off, Malik pressing to cover to get off the mark
Imam props half forward into a defensive push, 'no run!' is the call
Cummins keeps it in the channel, Imam defending from the crease
sharp yorker, zoning in on the base of off stump before Imam jabs to keep it out
dug in short at 142km/h, Imam ducking well under the bouncer
Imam thrusts his hands out at a rising delivery outside off, running the ball down to third man. A gully might have been useful there
Behrendorff hits a length, on off stump, and Imam defends to cover
just short of a good length, but nicely straight and Imam is a little cramped for room as he defends
a touch of seam movement in to him, but Imam works with it to pick up a single to fine leg
angled across Malik, on a length, and he defends back to the bowler
the nip-backer from Behrendorff, and it beats Malik's glance to hit him on the thigh
punched firmly off the back foot, but straight to cover
full and angling across Imam, who keeps an eye on it as he leaves alone
angled down to third man for one
wicket-to-wicket stuff from Stoinis, and Malik defends
nipping in off the seam, and it's nudged to midwicket
tapped to point, and they set off straight away for a single
keeps slightly low on off stump, but Imam gets his bat down in time to keep it out
angled down just outside off, and it's chopped through gully for one
Imam breaks the shackles, shuffling down to get close to a length delivery and hammering it high and handsome over long on - first boundary for 45 balls, and it's a big 'un
Behrendorff keeps it short of a length, Imam defending it back to him
short on off stump, and Imam rolls his wrists over a pull to deep midwicket
a length delivery shoots across Malik's bows as he raises his hands into a leave
Malik hops into a defensive poke to end the over
Imam shuffles across and flicks off his pads, but it's just the one
Malik whips his wrists over a length delivery to collect a single to midwicket
Stoinis aims this one much fuller, Imam digging it out to mid on
surprise bouncer! But it's also taken Carey by surprise, or at leas the extra bounce is too much for him as the ball loops over the batsman, over the keeper and down to the boundary
Stoinis reverts to length, Imam pushing to point
angled down to third man for one
Malik keeps his bat inside the line as Stoinis gets one to leave him outside off
he comes around the stumps, Imam flicking against the spin into the leg side
punched in front of point, off the back foot, and they're through for one
glanced with the spin behind square leg
arm ball, and has it hit pad first? There's half an appeal. Umpire says no
more bounce than turn, but it's negotiated as Imam presses to cover
glanced off the hip, slightly uppishly but well away from any fielder
Malik drives straight, without much power but with the placement for a single
Imam comes half forward, tucking defensively to point. That's the 60th dot of the innings
seaming in off the track, Imam falling over to off a little as he over-balances in defence
flicked off the pad and out to deep midwicket for a single
Stoinis hits the seam and gets it to go like a legcutter, but Malik wasn't interested as it was outside off and leaves well alone
Malik is forward to defend into the covers
full, and it's flicked off the toes for a single
Malik lunges forward to place a drive into the gap at cover, a single the result
nicely flighted, the ball lands on middle and leg and is met with solid defence
there's a yelp of excitement from Carey as Lyon gets one to rush on, but it's inside edged onto the pad

and big spin this time! In fact, there's an appeal - though not a very expansive one as Australia think he's edged it to Carey - and Michael Gough's finger shoots up! Imam doesn't think he's hit it, and sends it upstairs, reviewing. Gosh, replays show a massive gap between the ball and the bat, that's definitely not out, and the decision is over-turned. The bat might have hit the pad, which is what the on-field umpire heard
and solid defence ends the over
full, but it's driven straight to mid off
tucked into the leg side this time, but mid on is there to stop the run. Lyon in that position
Stoinis attacks the stumps, but he's kept out by Malik
floated up outside off, but Malik's weight is back so he's late into his drive
drifting in towards the pads, and Malik clips him smartly out to deep midwicket, where Cummins comes charging around the boundary and slides to stop it, saving a run. Committed stuff
biffed onto the grass banks! It's slightly short, and Imam picks up the length very quickly, shimmying down as he often does and swiping it powerfully over the boundary
nicely driven through the off side
good length outside off, defended
a half-hearted appeal for caught behind as he misses an attempted glide
uses his feet, the ball spins and he ends up kicking it away
a shorter delivery, whipped through midwicket
worked off the stumps to square leg
round the wicket, wide down the leg side although it did turn
works a shorter delivery into midwicket
fuller, pushed wide of long-on with a straight bat and they are able to make the second
pitches well outside leg, goes for the sweep and gets a tickle on it towards short fine leg
leans forward and drives a wide delivery nicely through point
fuller at the stumps, defended
plays to back to this which is slightly shorter, turned to the on side
over the wicket, straight, pushed to midwicket
this one turns from outside off and takes the inside edge as he plays forward
flicks this from off stump to deep midwicket where the second can't be stopped
touch shorter outside off, square cuts nicely through point and it's another brace
excellent delivery, spins and takes the outside edge but doesn't carry to sllp
and again, finds the edge, he's coming forward this time, goes to ground and wide of slip then runs towards third man
full on off stump, leans forward and dabs towards cover
worked off the pads but straight to square leg
on off stump, goes straight on, pushed square to the off side

given lbw, but he's called for the review! Back of a length, slides on with the arm, don't think there's any edge so it's all about the height. It is at the top of the pad, but is hitting the top of the stumps. That's very out
played to the leg side
he needs to be careful there, playing back and exposing his stumps to a pretty full delivery. He's able to drive it away safely this time
good length at off stump, defended om the front foot
short of a length, gets on his toes and punches into a gap at cover
full outside off, nice carry through to Carey
outside off, hood length, left alone
that's a bit wild...a short ball fired miles down the leg side, think that just came out wrong
short of a length at the body, tucked into square leg
driven firmly off the back foot to the cover sweeper
tossed up full outside off, driven to the off-side sweeper
opens the face and steers a shortly delivery to point
straighter, flicked off the stumps into midwicket
fuller, turns the face of the bat trying to work to leg
worked off the pads to short fine leg
very full at off stump, a punchy drive to deep cover
good length outside off, defended to cover
shorter, outside off, stays back and plays to point
across to off stump and works a short delivery to midwicket
full at the stumps, worked down to long leg
a bouncer, Malik allows it to go over his shoulder
that's a sharp short one, in at the ribs, fended around the corner
throws his hands through some width, back cuts between short third man and backward point
short on off stump, perhaps the googly, driven down to long-off
comes down the pitch, gets very close to the ball and it's a skimming drive that nearly finds long-off
outside off, steered through point
fuller, on the stumps, defended
tossed up outside off, driven along the ground to deep cover. Nothing too adventurous so far
back of a length, straight, tucks this wide of midwicket with the turn
shorter, turns quite significantly, played off the pads to the on side
finds deep midwicket! That was on the cards. Came down the track, wasn't to the pitch, still went through with a lofted shot over the leg side, the bat face twisted as well, and it's a simple catch
defended to the on side
beats the outside edge as he plays forward to one which holds its line
dragged down short, a rare poor ball from Lyon, pulled from outside leg to deep backward square
worked from off stump to the on side
big appeal for lbw, traps a fuller delivery between bat and pad, but must be outside leg stump
another googly, played off the back foot to the on side
fuller, on the stumps, clipped through midwicket
blocked on the front foot
leans back and opens the face, finds short third man
round the wicket, good length at middle and off, played to the on side
pushes a quicker delivery back to the bowler
well bowled, draws him forward and it turns to take the outer half of the bat towards point
pushes a length delivery to the off side
dragged down short and hammered through midwicket
whipped through the leg side, behind square this time...Umar deciding now is the time?
short on off stump this time, steps to leg and picks out backward point with the cut
that's a lovely delicate shot as he deflects this very fine down to third man
full at middle and off, pushed wide of cover
this turns from short of a length, Umar adjusts and taps to the covers...a good over of batting
leans forward and pushes into the covers
big appeal for lbw! Whipping across what looked a reasonably straight delivery but Australia decide against the review. Replay shows it was turning to miss leg
this is a little fuller, playing around his front and works to deep square
comes down the pitch, gets right to the ball and drills it through the covers with terrific placement
chopped into the ground and bobbles to point
full at off stump, a googly, defended to cover
round the wicket, cuts this off the stumps to backward point
stand and deliver, clubs a good length ball from outside off over mid-on who is inside the circle
slower, full outside off, played along the ground to long-off
stretches forward, steers into a gap at cover
good length on off stump, pushed to cover
on the stumps, tucked to square leg
short outside off, not a great delivery, cuts firmly square to deep cover
short and pulled to deep square leg
gets away with this, it's short outside off, the off-side field is largely up but he picks out point
nearly stumped! Came down the pitch, got an inside edge into the pad which trickled back towards Carey but he couldn't quite get it back to the stumps in time

dropped! Bit happening at the moment. Behrendorff has put down the chance at long-on as Umar came down the pitch and didn't get the distance. Was pretty regulation. He ended up trying to take it too low
played into the off side
driven firmly through the off side, wide of long-off
full outside off, pushed to point
down the pitch, clipped to midwicket inside the circle
a little shorter, he goes back and works to the leg side
play and a miss, slung across outside off, he was trying to angle it away through third man
pushed off the back foot to mid-off
back of a length at middle and off, defended
down the leg side, and he shouts in anger
short outside off, angled down to third man
comes down the pitch against a length ball outside off and lofts over cover
short of a length, angled into the pads, tucked to deep square leg
a short ball over leg stump, he goes for the hook, through to the keeper
pushes a length ball to the off side to keep the strike
speared down the leg side, too far for Umar's sweep
flicked with the spin, behind square, and there's the fifty stand
angled down towards gully
placed through cover point, and the sweeper jogs in to stop it
punched firmly, but not past midwicket
Umar waits on it and angles a dab, but the ball rushes on with the arm and beats the edge
slapped hard, but straight to point
Imad backs away from a short one, slashing it down to third man

caught in the deep! Just as the stand was starting to grow, Umar has tried to force the issue, skipping down the track and dragging a loft into the leg side. But he doesn't get all of it, and Cummins moves quickly to his left at deep midwicket, sliding to hold the catch
dug in short by Behrendorff, the ball bouncing over Imad. Too high, says the umpire
fuller, and it seams in to be nudged to midwicket
chopped hard into the ground, and bouncing up to point
slashed even more firmly, but Maxwell at point pulls off a sharp stop
short, and it's pulled out to long leg for a single
a bottom edged cut bounces hard into the turf and between the keeper's legs
pushed through cover
Yasir waits deep in his crease, glancing with the spin down to fine leg and rushing back for a second
quicker, just outside off, and it's punched to cover
full, driven back to the bowler
a tumbling stop at cover by Marsh stops a run off a back foot punch
and Imad jumps out to turn this into a low full toss, slapping it out to the cover sweeper
Yasir waits in his crease and works against the spin into the leg side
full, and it's nudged back to the bowler
a touch too short and spinning away outside off, and he finds the gap for a single
not much flight on this legbreak, Imad jabbing defensively to leg
a sliced cut goes right through the gap. Imad backed away and chopped it off the stumps, but places it right between backward point and short third man
a defensive push goes in front the point, and they scoot through for one
Imad spots some width and places another cut to the left of the sweeper, who runs across and keeps them to two
crunched out off the back foot to that sweeper again
Yasir waits in the crease and muscles a pull down to long on
this one rushes on with the arm, but Imad uses the angle to nudge a single in front of midwicket
quicker through the air at 92km/h, and it's chopped down to gully
clears his front leg and punts it straight down the ground. Powerfully hit
flicked with the spin into the leg side, they think about the second but decide against it
flighted up on off stump, and a drive brings a single to long off
quicker one, stump to stump, and it's glanced defensively to leg
whoops, this one heads down the leg side. It must have flicked the pad, not given as a wide
worked down to long on for one
Imad hops back at some width, cutting hard out to the sweeper
Yasir uses his feet to get down the track, but he's not to the pitch as it spins sharply in to him
slightly too short, outside off, and he's punched out to the cover sweeper
Imad turns around into a reverse slog-sweep, but it doesn't go the distance, plugging in the outfield towards third man. Handscomb makes excellent ground around the boundary, diving to save runs
punched down to long on for one
slightly short, but Yasir's pull goes straight to midwicket

Imad runs past a googly and is easily stumped. He was also slightly done in the flight, having jumped down the track. And Pakistan sink a little further. The take from Carey is very close to the stumps ... in front of them? Will have to see a replay. Anyway, Imad marches off
slightly quicker at 88km/h, and it's pushed defensively to off
googly, spinning in to him
slugged straight to mid off! Two in the over for Zampa. He flights up a legbreak, inviting the big shot, but Shinwari's slog can only get as far as Behrendorff at deep mid off
floated up on off stump, and it's dug out to cover
pushed through outside off, and he thrusts the pad out and leaves it alone
a leading edge balloons off a pull, but the ball bounces safely in no-man's land at deep backward square
pushed to mid off
chopped down through gully
pitched right up at close to 139km/h, and it's flicked off the toes
bursting off a length outside off, and past Junaid's fend
legbreak, spinning away from an off stump line to be punched to cover
slapped down to wide long on

Zampa has his third! Tossed up high and Junaid takes the bait, slogging wildly to send a swirling top edge into the air. Carey calls for it, and holds it with a reverse cup with his helmet grille slipping back over his head

there's a review. Zampa floats a googly up high and it rushes in to beat Hasnain's inside edge and hit him on the back leg. The appeal is turned down, but they ask for a review. Three reds, and he's gone!
